humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the patient had a left modified radical mastectomy and the final diagnosis is infiltrating duct carcinoma with a size of >2.5 by 2.0 by 1.5 cm. This meets the criteria for a T2 tumor, which is more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. The presence of ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) or the percentage of the tumor occupied by in situ component does not affect the T stage for invasive ductal carcinoma. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, regardless of the type of carcinoma. Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the patient has invasive duct carcinoma with a size of 2.5 cm (greater than 2 cm but not greater than 5 cm), which falls under T2 category according to the TNM staging system for cancer. The presence of lymphovascular space involvement and metastatic carcinoma in 8 out of 13 lymph nodes also supports the T2 stage, but those are used for N and M staging, not T staging.
